He couldn’t help but feel responsible for what had happened to Tyler, and what could happen to any of them, like Patrick or Kevin, the dorky-cute kid from first period. “If Tyler can’t defend himself, what hope does a kid like Kevin have?” he thought to himself.

The bell rang and he dismissed the class. As his fifth period class filed in, the last one before his planning period, he snapped himself out of it. “Tyler had problems long before I came along. All of them do. I am the only person who can help these kids. I know what it’s like to be different. And I KNOW that with time—and the appropriate changes—I can reshape their lives for the better.”

Kuai clutched the pendant with new found determination. In that instant, he made it his goal to find kids in need, outsiders, weaklings, and the friendless, and help slowly change their lives for the better. “I’ve found quite a few so far, but I bet there is at least one more in need of help.”

Kuai just had to wait for the opportunity to present itself. Introductions began again and not too long after, Kuai thought he may have found another kid in need…
1511111111122.title: Perceptions

choices: Something unexpected happens with Makani as the class ends
Kuai tries to make more changes to Makanii as he teaches
15111111111221.content:
The beginning of fifth period, however, put Kuai's determination to the test. Unlike the other classes, where he stood off to the side as the students gave their introductions, Kuai sat down behind his desk as he told the students what to do, too tired and upset from what had happened the previous period to stay on his feet.

The class was another Honors Pre-Algebra, and the kids definitely seemed more well-behaved than the previous classes, but also much less interesting. The first name that came up definitely stood out from the rest, though.

“Makani Akamu-Oke?” Kuai fumbled a bit with the pronunciation, looking around the classroom, not sure if he should be expecting a boy or girl to answer. After a few seconds of receiving blank stares from the class, though, he repeated the name. “Makani?” No one answered again, so he marked down the absence and continued with the list.

Boy after girl after boy came up, and Kuai couldn't find any that intrigued him. He knew that the indifference was beginning to show on his face, but he couldn't bring himself to fake any kind of interest right now.

After all the students had spoken, Kuai looked down at the roll list and sighed. "Can't there be just one boy who catches my attention like Kevin or Tyler?" he thought to himself as he stood back up to begin the lesson. "Is that too much to ask?"

As if in answer to his question, just as Kuai had put his marker to the board, the door flew open. Looking over, he saw a bronze-skinned boy with shaggy chestnut-brown hair covering his eyes and ears, reaching the collar of his polo, covering the back of a thin seashell necklace he wore. He had a thin build and stood about 5' 3", on par with the rest of the boys in his class. He meekly stepped into the room, eyes on his sneakers, ashamed for having interrupted the class.

“Ma-KAH-nee?” Kuai asked sternly. The boy nodded, avoiding eye contact with the class. “Am I pronouncing that right?”

“Y-yes, sir,” he said lowly.

From the back of the class, Kuai heard a couple of girls' voices start to whisper to each other. "Is that the new boy?" one of them said.

"Yeah, it is!" her higher-pitched friend said. "Did you hear what happened to him in third period?"

"You mean--"

Kuai turned around and frowned, stomping his foot down loudly as he did so, which got the girls to shut up. He then turned to the boy at the door, shaking his head. "Young man," he said, "this isn't a good way to start the year. I expect my students to be on time every day, especially on day one." He stepped a little closer to Makani in order to intimidate him a little, to make him think twice about being late.

The boy kept his head down as he held up a small slip of paper to Kuai. "I'm sorry, Mr. Tao," he mumbled. "I-- I was-- Here's my --" The boy swallowed hard, finally looking up to Kuai and tossing his head to one side to move the hair away, revealing a pair of deep, golden-brown eyes underneath. "I was at the Nurse's office."

Softening his glare a little, Kuai grabbed the note and studied it closely. The signature of the Nurse was spot-on; it appeared to be legit. Kuai slowly began to nod. "Okay. You're excused… for today," he added for emphasis.

The young man visibly sighed with relief, getting ready to head to the only open desk, in the front row. "Hold on," Kuai stopped him, "one thing, while you're up here." The boy froze, turning around after a few seconds and looking up at Kuai with a bit of fright in his eyes. "It's nothing big," Kuai said, trying not to come off too harsh, "but I'm sure everyone would like to hear a bit more about you." Receiving a questioning look from the boy, Kuai motioned to the board. "Just stand in front of the class and tell us your name and a little about yourself. Your interests, what you did this summer, things like that."

The boy hesitated, looking petrified. "O-okay," he finally said, slowly shuffling up to the board, still holding his notebook. He turned his body to face the class, but his head was still pointing down at the ground. "My-- my name is M-Makani Akamu-Oke." He clutched one arm with his hand, trying to keep his balance. "I… M-my family moved here from Hilo, Hawaii last month."

Kuai leaned forwarded at this, his curiosity piqued at last. He didn't like to cut in on his students, but he had to find out more about this exotic new kid. "Oh, really?" he asked. "Why? What brought you to the other side of the world?"

Makani turned his head towards Kaui, uncertainty flickering in his eyes. "Uhhhh…" He shifted nervously from one foot to another, finally taking a deep breath. "I-- My dad, and-- uh… I mean my parents--" Another big gulp later, he furrowed his brow in determination and finally spat it out. "My dads moved to Massachusetts to get married. They-- they were tired of not having -- of… you know, not having the same rights as other couples… so when one of them got an Associate Professorship at Northeastern…"

"I see," Kuai said, nodding in approval, ignoring the snickering coming from the class. "Good for them."

"Yeah…" Makani looked like he felt a little grateful to get that off his chest. Kuai knew revealing that kind of information on the first day would not make the boy very popular, but he knew that it took courage for him to do so, especially considering how closed-off Makani seemed to be otherwise. The boy started fiddling with a metal bracelet on his wrist and continued, "Anyway, I guess I like doing things outside… When we were in Hawaii, me and my older brother Kale would go surfing almost every weekend."

Kuai could hear a girl in the class swoon, and he could understand. He definitely enjoyed the image in his mind of this attractive Hawaiian boy riding a wave, his wet brown skin glistening in the Hawaii sun. As much as it made Kuai happy for the boy's fathers to be able to get married to each other, it almost seemed criminal for him to have to live this far north.

As Makani continued to talk about his interests, Kuai realized that this was the boy he had been looking for all period. Whether or not he had a surfboard beneath him, Kuai could still make sure that he at least looked like a surfer, with a muscled, ripped body. While all eyes in the class were up front, Kuai started to form a picture in his mind of a taller Makani, with a much more toned body, one that would turn heads on any beach.

It only took a few seconds for Makani to start becoming bigger. His body inched upward, growing taller little by little as the class watched, unaware of what was going on right in front of their eyes. Kuai noticed the boy's legs, sticking out of his shorts, not only were getting longer, but the calf muscles were growing larger and more rounded. His chest pushed outwards, the fabric of the shirt conforming to the hills and valleys of his pecs and abs, and his biceps and triceps swelling and rippling as the boy kept moving back and forth.

His transformation now finished, Makani now looked more like a proper surfer: ripped physique with a healthy glow and a broad stature. It might not have been quite a big a transformation as Tyler's, but Makani still had to be one of the biggest kids in the seventh grade, and Kuai could tell that virtually all of the girls in class were watching as the boy finished talking and returned to his seat.

Kuai smiled at the changes he had made, now ready to start with the lesson, feeling more enthusiastic about the day.
15111111111221.title: New Blood

choices: Kuai wanders the campus during his planning period, finding boys in other grades
Kuai is unexpectedly called to the principal's office.
151111111112211.content:
Wrapping up his lesson as the bell rang, Kuai walked over to the door, watching the students file out of the room. He sighed, happy to be finally finished with classes, only having his planning period left. He also thought about all the boys he had grown during the day, trying to decide which one was the most enjoyable change.

After the classroom emptied, Kuai looked up and noticed that Makani still remained seated at his desk, his eyes facing the board and his hands propping up his chin, his body motionless. Watching him for a moment, Kuai finally cleared his throat and said, "Makani? It's the end of class. Time to go."

The boy didn't respond, still staring straight forward. Starting to get concerned, Kuai moved over towards his desk. Usually, the sight of such a large body standing above would be enough to get any of his students' attention, but Makani didn't blink an eye. "Are you alright?" Kuai asked, waving his hand in front of Makani's face. As he did so, he noticed the bracelet that Makani had been playing with earlier as he introduced himself to the class. Looking closer, Kuai saw a clasp on one side that looked like it could be opened. "It must be a medical bracelet," he realized.

Taking a deep breath, he gently grabbed the boy's wrist and popped open the clasp. Inside, a small panel read "Makani Akamu-Oke 2/15/1999, This patient has Epilepsy. If seizure lasts more than 5 minutes call 911." Kuai breathed in deeply, trying to calm down his swirling emotions as he realized what was going on.

At that moment, Makani blinked and jerked his head up to look at Kuai. When he saw the large man looming over him, Makani's eyes lit with a fiery glow. He seemed a but disoriented, and as he began to comprehend his situation, his mouth dropped open in shock. Kuai kneeled in response, keeping his hand close to the boy's arm. "It's okay, stay calm," he said as softly as possible. "Do you know where you are and who I am?"

After a second of examining Kuai's face and his surroundings, recognition replaced confusion. "You're my Pre-algebra teacher, Mr. Tao. And -- I - I'm still in your classroom?"

Kuai nodded, the corners of his lips turning upward in relief. "Right, Makani. That's right. Are you feeling okay?"

"Yeah," Makani said, closing his eyes and rubbing his forehead with his hand. "I-- I must've just had a …"

"A seizure," Kuai finished, indicating the medical bracelet. "I was worried when you didn't leave with the others, so I opened it up."

Makani squirmed some in his seat, but his eyes softened as he stared at Kuai. The same fire from a moment ago returned in Makani’s amber-colored eyes, but only for a moment. Suddenly and without warning, Makani just grabbed his notebook, jumped to his feet and hurryed towards the door.

A little disappointed, Kuai stood back up, eyeing the boy's muscled legs as the cuffs of his shorts swished just above his knees as he walked away. "Are you sure you're good to go to your next class?"

Makani halted immediately and lingered in the doorway. “Let me at least write you a note,” Kuai offered.

Makani turned and slowly approached Kuai’s desk. He kept his head tilted down and spoke through his thick chestnut hair. "Thank you Mr. Tao. This year is going to be tough as it is. I… I need to make sure that I start my next class off on the right foot, unlike what I did with you." He hesitated, but finished his apology. "I... I'm sorry if I offended you earlier by being late."

In an instant, Makani's humbleness and sense of personal honor won Kuai over for good. "Not at all," Kuai said, chuckling. "I hope you didn't feel too put off by my attitude earlier. Without a doubt, I’m serious about my students and want to be absolutely sure they are always prepared. However, I never judge or hold a grudge against them— or you.”

For the first time all day, Makani began to smile. Kuai handed him a slip of paper. Makani gently removed it from Kaui’s grip, still daunted by the size of his math teacher.

"Heh," he said, tossing his hair out of his eyes, “That’s incredibly fair of you, Mr. Tao. I promise that your kindness will not be wasted.”

This time, it was clear that Makani wanted to make full eye contact with Kaui. Already his confidence was building and Kuai knew it. Even through his shyness, Kuai could tell Makani had an unexplainable charisma about him, something that captivated Kuai. The flames in this boy’s eyes said it all. Underneath this meek shell was a powerful person just waiting to be unleashed. And Kuai had the power to do just that.

Makani gripped his medical bracelet in one hand. Kuai took that opportunity to brake Makani’s intensifying gaze. Pointing to the bracelet, Kuai said, “I’ll be sure to keep an eye on you. And please feel free to come by anytime if you need something. I am here for you and the other students.”

Makani's grin became an enchanting smile. The flames in his eyes held Kuai tightly to him as they continued to grow. Makani looked even taller than he had been after the change, his back and neck straining to reach up to his teacher. Kuai could've sworn he was holding his head higher, his muscled neck straightening out. "I will certainly do that, Mr. Tao," he said, taking Kuai's hand and shaking it with a surprisingly firm grasp, biceps flexing as he did so. "Thanks."

Makani’s spell broke, for now. He broke his gaze from Kuai just as the tardy bell rang. Makani released Kuai’s hand. "I'd better hurry to class. I'll see ya tomorrow!"

Kuai stood in the doorway and watched the muscled Hawaiian boy stride down the hall. Right before Makani turned the corner, he looked back. Surprisingly, he had a somewhat embarrassed smile on his face. "You know, you're the only teacher today to pronounce my name right on the first try."

He waved, then disappeared. Sighing, Kuai turned back to the classroom, his eyes wandering from wall to wall as he tried to organize his feelings. It took him a moment to recover from his after-class encounter with Makani. Kaui hadn’t realized it until now, but his face was hot and he was breathing rather quickly for only having been standing still. He even found that he was slightly light-headed. Makani had quite the effect on Kaui, and more interestingly, Kaui hadn’t even noticed until after it was over.

Finally finding a way to push those thoughts aside, Kuai was left only with the emptiness of his classroom. A combination of relief for a job well done, anticipation for the rest of his day, and loneliness set in. Kuai knew that he would be seeing all of his favorites again tomorrow, and there were plenty of other students to encounter all throughout the school.
151111111112211.title: Lighting the Fire Inside

choices: Kuai helps another kids the following day
Kuai goes somewhere else
1511111111122111.content:
It was the last period of the day, which was the planning period. Luckily for Kuai, he really didn't have planning to do yet. He pretty much had everything ready for the rest of the week, since it was only the first day of class. He needed to cover pretty much the first chapter of the book in almost every class that he taught, which meant that he was just going over old material, or repeating stuff from the previous year that the kids should have already covered before. It was then all new material from there, and he would end the first week of class with a small quiz in all his classes at the end of the week, most likely on Friday or on Monday, giving him the weekend to do most of the grading.

He had written down the lesson plans for all his classes, which all covered just about the same math subjects, and he knew he could use the math quizzes he prepared the previous year. All he needed to do was go to the teachers' lounge and run off enough photocopies to hand out to the students. Once he was done with that, he was actually done for the day. There were still thirty minutes left in the period, and there was no reason for him to sit around an empty classroom during the final period of the day, so he decided to go out and wander around the athletic facilities and see what was going on.

As he strolled up to the glass door to the gym, he spotted a few kids sitting on the wooden bench on the sidelines while most of the boys were playing a pickup game of basketball as Coach Thompson was blowing the whistle as the referee. Kuai immediately recognized most of the kids in there, since he just had them during the fifth period math class in his own classroom. Much to his surprise, he saw that Makani was one of the boys who was sitting on the bench. How come he wasn't playing basketball with the rest of the class?

Kuai quietly opened the side door to the gym and walked in. He walked along the perimeter of the court, in order not to disrupt the game that was in progress. Then, he decided to sit down on the wooden bench, next to the muscular boy from Hawaii.

"Hey..." he whispered to him.

"Oh, hi Mr. Tao!" Makani said, with a surprised expression on his face.

"I was done with my planning work, and I dicided to walk around. I saw you guys were in here, so I figured I'd come and take a look!" Kuai explained. "So, how come you're not playing?"

"Well... Umm..." Makani mumbled, as he pulled on his silver-and-red Medic Alert bracelet. "I'm excused from participating in P.E. class..." he said in a downcast tone of voice.

"Is it because of... Epilepsy?"

Makani let out a deep sigh in reply as he stared at the wooden hardcourt floor.

"So, you can't participate in any sports at all?" Kuai asked him.

"Well, I surf and swim with my dad... Plus I got a treadmill and a weight bench at home, so I can lift weights when there's someone there to watch me!" he replied excitedly. "I lift weights at home!"

The score between the two teams had just tied, and Makani suddenly looked up, ready to cheer on his classmates. He then stood up, took a few steps forward, and started cheering.

"Come on, Asher! Just one minute to go! Go, team, go! Go, Tim! Go, Steve! The score is tied! You guys need to score! GO!!!" Makani started shouting at his classmates.

Kuai couldn't feel more proud. Here was a boy who couldn't play, due to a disability. Yet, he was so selfless and so supportive of those classmates who were on the court, that he would still come out and cheer on all his classmates!

As Kuai looked up and saw the Hawaiian boy standing in front of him, he quietly took hold of the pendant with his fingers. This kid had shown so much passion, and so much character, he couldn't help but imagine Makani with just a little more muscles, perhaps in his arms and in his legs.

Just as Kuai had imagined, Makani's calves swelled even more. They were already big, from the previous growth spurt, and now they had growth to the size of pro-soccer-star-level. The boy's thighs thickened a bit, adding layers of muscle as well, becoming big enough so that he wouldn't look too big. Kuai didn't want the boy to look like a bodybuilder. At least, he looked like he lifted plenty of weights and the other kids would respect him in the hallway and the jocks would know by now NOT to push him around. Kuai also wanted to make sure nobody would dare pick on him just because he had a disability.

Lastly, Makani's arms inflated a bit more, as his biceps ballooned to the size of softballs. With bulging triceps and a nice vein running over his bicep and down his arm, the Hawaiian boy was dangerously close to resembling a pro weight lifter. All the other students would be aware of the fact that this boy was strong!

Makani finally shouted out loud as the team scored the final basket as the clock ran down to zero.

"We won! We won!!!"

The happy Hawaiian boy sat down next to Kuai, with a wide grin on his face. Just then, another boy named Asher sat down right next to him, reaching over and grabbing a small gym bag that sat on the floor behind him.

"Nice basket, Asher! Good game!" Makani cheered.

"Thanks, dude. Here, my mom gave me a small jar with jelly to take with me. It's really sweet..." Asher said, as he pulled a small sealed glass jar containing a red substance out of his bag. The skinny boy, who was much smaller than Makani, wrapped his fingers around the lid on the jar as he strained to unscrew it.

After two tries and failing, he turned and looked at Makani.

"Want me to try?" Makani asked him.

Asher stared at Makani, examining his bulging biceps.

"Yeah..." Asher said, as he handed him the jar.

Makani casually placed his bronze-skinned fingers around the edges of the cap, and gave it a twist as the thick biceps in his arms flexed while Asher looked on. There was a loud POP and the cap came off.

"There ya go..." Makani smiled, as he handed the opened jar and the cap to his friend. "Piece of cake..."

"Dang... You're STRONG!" Asher exclaimed, as he took the jar of jam from his classmate.

Makani just shrugged, as Kuai looked on at the two boys with a wide grin on his face. Kuai pondered helping Asher out later, but he certainly felt proud of his big Hawaiian boy at that moment.
1511111111122111.title: Kuai goes to the gym during planning period

choices: Makani gets to stay with Kuai and Sean
Makani stays with Kuai's next-door neighbors
15111111111221111.content:
Kuai returned to school the next day and continued his math classes as usual. This time, he was actually looking forward to seeing all his students, especially the ones he got to grow bigger the previous day. In a way, he felt bad that he had already changed these boys and made them bigger, because it meant that he had to go out and look for other boys to grow. He was still extremely happy to see Kevin, Tyler and Makani in his class, and all three boys did extremely well. They were all well-liked and respected by now, and they had slowly become known as the big three boys on campus. This made Kuai very happy and it only confirmed the fact that he needed to spend more time walking around after school, so he could see if there were others he could help using his pendant.

Once class was over for the day, Kuai wandered around the athletic fields surrounding the school yard and the large main buildings where the classrooms where located, looking for new students to assist. He loved sports and sports activities and he supported any student who was actively involved in athletics. Not only that, but he was also involved in the basketball program at the school, so he had a personal interest in seeing that the student athletes at his school excelled in sports and athletic competition.

Kuai walked over to the football field, where he spotted a young man named Anthony, an eighth grader at the school. Kuai saw that Anthony was practicing throwing the football to Chad, another one of the members on the football team. Anthony was a little bit shorter and thinner than Chad, and he struggled with attaining the same reach as Chad did, when throwing the ball. Chad was able to launch the ball from a distance and to have the ball land in Anthony's hands, but Anthony came a few yards short every time he tried returning the ball to him. Kuai saw that and decided to give him a hand.

While holding the pendant in his hand, Kuai glanced over at Anthony from where he was sitting, in the bleachers, and he began to imagine what Anthony would look like, if he were to gain another thirty pounds of muscle and if he grew another six to eight inches taller. Just as the previous few times, that was exactly what happened: Kuai saw Anthony change right before his very eyes, since he was standing on the field before him wearing a t-shirt and shorts with running shoes.

Anthony's arms and legs thickened and grew longer right away, making him grow eight inches taller in the process. His torso also expanded as he grew wider by a few inches. Next, every muscle in his body began to swell, as thirty pounds of raw muscle was evenly added and distributed across his entire body in a matter of just a few seconds. His biceps and pectorals grew firmer and his abdominals became more defined while his calves ballooned outward from the back of his legs. His thighs increased by layers of muscle and every muscle became hard all over. This time, when Anthony threw a football, it clearly sailed right over Chad's head! Chad had to run in order to get the ball, because Anthony had thrown the ball so high and with so much force!

Kuai had grinned when he saw the effect of his little growth spurt on the boy and decided to go home so that he could have dinner with Sean, his boyfriend. It was Friday night, and he was looking forward to the weekend. He had a lot of math quizzes to grade, but he knew that he could get it all done once he got started on it. He was already looking forward to seeing his big boys in class on Monday morning.

During the weekend, Kuai just focused on relaxing and grading math quizzes. He knew he had the pendant, and he could have gone out to have some fun with that. He actually wanted to try something new and use the pendant to make someone grow really big, he just didn't know who to grow and how big to make him yet. He wanted to be careful and try it out on either a new person or someone whom he had used it on already, and just make that person really big, like seven or eight feet tall or more. He needed time to think about this.

During the fifth period math class, he had Makani. Although Kuai was happy to see the big Hawaiian boy in class, the big surfer boy seemed unusually quiet that afternoon. After class was over, Makani was the last to get up from his desk, and Kuai addressed him right away as the Pacific Islander stumbled over towards the door.

"Hey, Makani! What's going on? You seem a bit down!" Kuai said to him.

"Hey Mr. Tao... My parents... We may be leaving again soon..." he replied sadly.

"Really? You guys just got here!"

"I know, but my dad just got a six-month internship in Washington State... So, I don't know what's gonna happen to me... I hope I don't have to move again... I want to stay here... I like it here..." Makani sighed, while staring at the floor.

"Gosh, dude... That's tough! You just started school here, too!" Kuai added. "That would be really hard on your grades to change school at the beginning of the year!"

"I know... But, I need a place to stay... Unless my parents can find me a foster family here... Someone who can take care of me during the next six months..."

"Give me your father's cell phone number!" Kuai responded.

Makani gave Kuai his father's cell, while giving him a curious look.

"Are... Are you gonna call my dad?" he stuttered. "What... Why?"

"You need a foster family to stay with?" Kuai asked the boy.

"Y-y-yeah?"

"You can stay with me!" Kuai grinned.

"You... You're kidding, right? Are you serious?" Makani gasped.

"I'll call your parents and invite them over to my apartment this evening. I'll take care of everything!" Kuai said with a wink.

"Whoa! Thanks, Mr. Tao!" the Hawaiian boy cheered, as he walked out of the classroom.

After Makani had left, Kuai picked up the phone and dialed the number. He spoke with Makaio, one of his fathers, about the possibility of becoming Makani's guardian while his fathers go to Washington State on an internship for six months. This would mean that he would have the big boy living with him, and he would have plenty of opportunities to use his pendant on the boy.
15111111111221111.title: Kuai helps other kids the following day

choices: Grocery shopping
To the shopping mall
151111111112211111.content:
Things went surprisingly well for Kuai that evening. He got to meet both of Makani’s fathers, who were more than excited to meet their son’s math teacher. They had already heard an earful about this famous teacher, and now they finally got to meet him in person. What made the evening even more interesting was the fact that Kuai was willing to become Makani’s guardian while his two fathers went to Washington State for their internship. Kuai showed that he had nothing more than Makani’s best interest at heart, and he argued that it would be extremely difficult for the boy to maintain good grades if he were to be taken out of school during the middle of the school year. Both of his fathers agreed and they started making arrangements for having the Pacific Islander stay with his math teacher.

They gave Kuai several thousand dollars, enough to covers basic expenses like food and clothing, but also money for medication and visits to the neurologist. Obviously, there was a concern about Makani’s seizures, but Kuai assured them that he would do everything to ensure the boy’s mental and physical well-being. He would treat the boy like he were his own son, and he would call his fathers if anything were ever to go wrong.

Makani arrived at Kuai’s place the following day with two suitcases and a soft bag filled with clothes, books, and some old toys which he had brought along with him from the days he was still living in Hawaii, and Kuai showed him the small guest room where the boy could put away the clothes and all his belongs and make himself at home. Makani then hugged his fathers as they said their goodbyes and left to go to the airport.

“Alright, champ… Let’s see what’s on TV, okay?” Kuai said, as he took the remote and switched on the flat screen TV set in the living room. “Go ahead and make yourself at home!”

Makani changed into his tank top and shorts, and he removed his socks and sneakers so he now just walked around the house barefoot.

“I look your carpet… It’s so nice and soft! Do you mind if I watch TV on the floor?” the boy asked his teacher.

“No, go right ahead!” Kuai replied, as he sat down in his recliner chair next to the couch.

Makani lied down on his stomach with his legs stretched out completely, resting his chin in the palms of his hands while his elbows were on the floor in front of him.

“Here, champ… Here is a pillow in case you decide to doze off!” Kuai chuckled, as he tossed the boy a pillow that was on the couch.

“Ahh… Thanks, Mr. Tao!” Makani replies, as he rested his head on the pillow as he watched TV from the carpeted floor.

Kuai couldn’t help but grin as he looked down and see the Hawaiian boy lying on the floor before him. He figured the teen must have been tired from packing and moving his things and unpacking all his belongings again that day. Indeed, it only took about twenty minutes for Makani to doze off on the carpet in the middle of Kuai’s living room.

When Kuai looked down, he couldn’t help but smile as he saw the young, tall, muscular Hawaiian surfer boy on the ground before him. His eyes were closed, and his long, black hair was covering part of his face. His mouth was open just slightly, making him seem so cute as he lay there, sound asleep. It was hard to imagine that the boy was only twelve years old, for he seemed a few years older since he was so big now. As Kuai looked down at his pendant, the temptation to make the boy grow a little more became almost unbearable.

Makani’s legs were several inches away from the edge of the couch on the floor. As Kuai focused on the boy’s bronze legs and feet, he concentrated on his legs growing longer until they just barely touched the edge of the couch. The pendant immediately worked its magic on the sleeping boy, and Makani’s legs suddenly grew about eight inches longer!

Kuai blinked when he saw that Makani’s leg moved as it rubbed against the edge of the couch. The Hawaiian boy let out a soft moan, as he turned his head around. Kuai laughed as he realized that he had unintentionally grown Makani over six feet tall by now, and it would be interesting to see how tall he would be once the boy wakes up.

“Hmmm…” Makani groaned, as he shook his head and stood up.

“Hey, you took a little nap there, big guy!” Kuai said, as he got up from the couch.

Makani stood up and walked over to Kuai. The math teacher guessed that the boy was just about an inch or so past six feet tall now.

“Ohh… Yeah… That felt great…. Umm… Mr. Tao?” he asked shyly. “Can I get something to drink?”

“Sure, champ! The glasses are in the cupboard to the right of the fridge! We got soda and juice in the fridge, so help yourself. I suggest we go get something to eat in a few, and then we can go to the grocery store and stock up on some food for the two of us, okay?” Kuai replied.

As Makani walked to the fridge and opened the door, Kuai held on to the pendant and imagined the boy growing to the same height as him. Kuai figured it would be fun having the boy be the same height as him, so he didn’t have to look down on him all the time. He always had to look down on all the kids at school, but now he didn’t have to look down on Makani anymore, if he made the boy grow to six-foot-nine, same height as him.

While Makani stood there and poured some water and ice into a glass, he felt his legs grow longer, his arms lengthen a few inches, and his torso stretch out further. Luckily, his muscles were also growing in proportion with the rest of his body, and the Hawaiian boy noticed how his pectorals, his thighs and his calves were inflating all at the same time as well. The boy had quickly grown to the same impressive size as Kuai, and his clothes were much too small for him now.

“Uhh… Mr. Tao?”

“Yes? What’s up, champ?”

“My clothes must have shrunk or something…” the boy said, as he slowly walked back to the living room, holding a glass of water in his right hand.

Kuai stood up and couldn’t help but smile. Makani was exactly the same height as him.

“Well… You’re as big as me, so you could wear my clothes now…” Kuai replied.

“Oh, yeah…” Makani grinned. “Cool!”

“But we can go to the mall and buy you some shorts and t-shirts!”

Kuai got Makani some clothes to wear and the two young men got ready to go out and have some fun. They had some shopping to do, and some errands to run, and Kuai couldn’t wait to show off his new big Hawaiian student to the rest of the world.
151111111112211111.title: Makani gets to stay with Kuai and Sean

choices: Pac-Sun, for some awesome, surfer-style attire
The Apple Store, to check out the latest gadgets
1511111111122111112.content:
As Kuai headed out the door, he saw Sean's small compact car pull into the driveway and his boyfriend get out. "Hey, Makani," Sean said, "how are ya liking your new home so far?"

"It's great, Mr. Sean," Makani beamed as Sean stopped in front of him. Kuai tried to stifle a laugh as he watched his average-sized boyfriend crane his neck upwards to talk to the boy behemoth like it was an everyday occurrence. Kuai wondered for a moment if other people that saw him and Sean when they went out on dates were thinking the same thing about the difference in height between the two of them. He cracked a smile at the thought.

"Please, buddy," Sean said, shaking his head while grinning, "I'm not your teacher. Call me Sean, not 'Mr. Sean.'"

"Okay… Sean," Makani nodded.

"So where are you two big guys off to?"

"We're gonna take the T down to South Shore Plaza and see if we can find some clothes for Makani," Kuai answered. "He's seem to have, um… outgrown his current ones."

"Really?" Sean asked, continuing to smile as he headed to the front door of their house. Winking at Makani, he said, "I figured; that shirt looked like it might have been one of Kuai's. I guess a growing boy like you probably has to get new threads every few months, right?"

Blushing, Makani nodded. "More or less. Not that often, but close."

Waving goodbye to Sean, Makani and Kuai started walking down the sidewalk. The train station was only four blocks from Kuai's house, and it took about five minutes to get there. Kuai paid the two dollars for a ticket, while Makani swiped his student pass, which had unlimited access. Luckily, the southbound train that they needed had just pulled up to the station as they stepped onto the platform, and they hopped onboard.

The car they had got on nearly was overflowing with all the late Friday rush hour commuters heading home to the suburbs after a tiring work week downtown. Kuai saw that only one seat in the entire car appeared to be open. He motioned for Makani to sit down in it, but the boy shook his head. "No way," he grinned. "I want to subway surf!"

"Subway surf?" Kuai narrowed his eyes in puzzlement, with a slight sense of concern.

"Yeah!" Makani said as he found an open space in the car with not many other people around. "It's when you ride the subway standing up, without holding on to any rails or anything, and try to keep your balance as you do so, just like on a surfboard. I've only seen people do it on YouTube, but if I know how to surf for real, I should have no problem doing the same kinda thing in a subway car!"

Kuai couldn't help but feel a bit skeptical. "Well, first of all, this part of the line is above ground, so we're technically not on a subway. And secondly," he softened his voice out of concern, the boy's condition in the back of his mind, "isn't it dangerous?"

Makani didn't have time to answer as the train lurched to a start. Kuai grabbed on to the rail running across the ceiling in the middle aisle, but Makani stuck out his hands and arms, trying to keep his balance. Other passengers in the car quickly moved out of the way, clearly afraid that the large boy would topple over and crush them.

But Makani seemed to have no trouble staying vertical. The train reached full speed, banking around a corner. All the while, the Hawaiian muscle boy's feet stayed firm, his large pillar-like legs keeping him steady, and his torso tilting and flowing along, countering the forces of gravity and inertia, keeping him standing upright.

As he got more comfortable, Makani made eye contact with Kuai and smiled. Impressed with the boy's skill, Kuai returned the smile and gave him a thumbs up. Makani brought his hand up as well, but instead of a thumbs up, he extended his thumb and pinky, flashing the "hang loose" sign, sticking out his tongue in playful fun.

The train's brakes began to squeal, the vehicle quickly decelerating. Makani leaned forward, looking like he almost was going to have to reach out and grab a pole, but quickly recovered before the train came to a stop. More people got up and left, opening up two seats, which Kuai and Makani both took. It was a bit of a tight squeeze, the two 6' 9" muscle-bound guys sitting in seats designed for people about two-thirds their size, but Makani didn't seem to mind, and Kuai enjoyed the chance to be so close to his…

His what, Kuai thought to himself. His student? No, that was too formal, and didn't represent nearly what their relationship had blossomed into. His protege? Perhaps, but that still sounded off. He would have liked to be able to call Makani something like his son, but Makani had two wonderful fathers who had prior claim to that title. Finally, he just decided on calling him his friend, because that's what the boy had now become.

As the train continued to roll down the tracks, Makani turned to Kuai, a spark of some idea in his fiery amber eyes. Noticing this fire, the corners of Kuai's lips turned upward. "What's that look for, Makani?"

"Nothing," the boy said. He faced forward again, his hair falling down and covering his eyes. After a few seconds, though, he took a deep breath and turned back to Kuai. "I just wanted to say, Mr. Tao--"

"Kuai. When we're not in school, please call me Kuai."

"O-okay," Makani's bronze cheeks started turning red slightly, "uh… I just wanted to say, Kuai…" He had put an extra emphasis on the name, as if his mouth was savoring the chance to say it. "… that I'm really grateful for you and Sean taking me in for these six months, and for you personally being so willing to help me out. Everything you've done has really been more than I could ever ask for, or hope to repay."

"Hey," Kuai protested, "don't say that! You don't need to repay me anything. I'm doing this because you're a great guy worthy of a shot at success. I know if you have the support you need, you can excel at anything: school, sports… even be able to overcome your…"

"My epilepsy?"

Kuai nodded. "That or whatever else comes your way. You're twelve years old, you're life has barely begun. There's going to be things that happen to you down the road that you won't see coming. But," Kuai turned and stared straight into Makani's eyes, the fire inside them now blazing, "if you're confident in who you are, and in who you've surrounded yourself with, then you can't lose."

Makani began to mist up, and he began to sniff a bit. Kuai gently placed his arm across the boy's broad shoulders, giving him a gentle, encouraging pat on the back, then quickly bringing it back to his side. The rest of the train ride went uneventful, and as they stepped off, Kuai noticed the sky had grown darker during the trip, evening setting in. The bright lights of the mall shone in the distance, beckoning them forward. They quickly marched the two blocks, finally arriving at the mall doors.

Being a Friday, the mall was packed. Large groups, mostly teens and twenty-somethings, mulled around in the center hallway, and as Kuai and Makani stepped inside, dozens of heads turned, staring in awe at the 6' 9" athletic Asian man and the equally tall and doubly more-impressive Hawaiian boy that accompanied him. Kuai glanced at Makani out of the corner of his eye, knowing the boy saw all the eyes fixed on them, and relieved that Makani seemed to be delighted with all the attention.

"Hey," Makani said as he walked up to the mall directory, examining it quickly, "why don't we first head to…"
1511111111122111112.title: To the shopping mall

choices: A growing boy needs large clothing!
The crowds start to become too much for Makani
15111111111221111122.content:
From the moment Makani walked into the Apple Store, he was an instant celebrity. The tall Hawaiian surfer boy strolled over to the table whee the iPods were on display, and started playing with one of the newest mp3 players. Almost immediately, two teens walked up to him, wondering what he was doing.

"Man, they need to load some surfing tunes on this thing! There is nothing but classical music on this iPod. Who listens to that?" Makani grumbled, while holding the small device in his large, bronze hand.

Another teenager stood next to him, not sure whether to address Makani as a teen or as a grownup, since he was so tall.

"Well, some grownups listen to classical music, like my dad! What do you listen to, Mister?" the teen asked him.

"Mister? I'm no grownup! I'm a kid, just like you!" Makani replied with a grin on his face.

"Whoa! How... How old are you?" the boy asked him.

Another boy walked up and stood next to him. This boy had the same facial expression, so Makani guessed that they were brothers.

"Me? I'm only twelve years old!"

"Wow! I'm thirteen and my brother is sixteen and you're bigger than both of us!" the youngest of the two boys exclaimed.

"Oh... Uhhh..." Makani said, with his face turning a little red.

"Wow, look at his muscles! That guy is huge! He must be super strong!" the older boy gasped.

"Must be all the surfing I did back when I was in Hawaii" Makani chuckled as he flexed his right arm.

Both teens stared at the big teen with amazement when Makani finally decided he wanted to move to the next table and look at the iPads.

"Do you guys want to check out this iPod?" he asked the two boys. Both boys nodded. They were staring at the tall Hawaiian in complete disbelief after they heard he was only 12 years old.

Makani handed them the iPod and wandered over to the next table where several iPads were on display. He picked up one of the tablets and began looking for an icon of a game he could try out. No sooner had he started playing a game on the iPad, which emitted many funny sounds while he played it, or two boys and a girl walked up next to him and tried to see what he was doing. One of the boys had to stand on his toes in order to see the screen, due to Makani's height. Makani saw his, and decided to greet the kids who had surrounded him.

"Hey! You guys want to try?" he asked one of the boys.

"Sure! What are you playing?" the boy asked.

"Angry Birds!" the big Hawaiian responded while he handed the iPad to the boy. "Just tap here and push the bird back and fire him at these pigs over on the right! You gotta try to knock down as many pigs as possible!"

Just as the boy started playing, a young man wearing a blue shirt with an Apple logo on it came walking up to them.

"Can I help you with anything?" the sales representative asked.

"Can I get the Angry Birds game for my iPod as well?" Makani asked him.

"I'm sure you can, Sir! Just log on to iTunes and purchase the game with your credit card and then download it to your iPod!" the man explained.

"Uhhh... I'm too young to get a credit card. Is there a free version?" Makani asked.

"I'm sure there is, Sir!" the man replied, before walking off. "Just search for it on the app store!"

"Thank you" Makani replied.

Kuai had overheard the conversation and couldn't help but chuckle at the fact that most people had a hard time guessing Makani's age right now. Most people were probably guessing that he was a teenager or a college student, due to the fact that he was so big and tall. Nobody would ever think that he was still twelve years old! Wouldn't it be even funnier if he made Makani grow even bigger than he was now?
15111111111221111122.title: The Apple Store, to check out the latest gadgets

choices: On their way, a talent scout spots Makani and offers him a modeling job
They make it to Macy's, which has plenty of clothes for Makani to "grow" in to
151111111112211111221.content:
Kuai stood near the front of the store, trying to appear busy with the new white iPhones while in reality he was watching Makani out of the corner of his eye. The whole store seemed to gravitate around the towering Hawaiian, a small throng following him as he headed to the back of the store and picked up a pair of headphones for his iPod. A couple of teens slightly older than Makani even pulled out their phones and snapped a couple of quick pictures. "I wonder if they think he's a basketball player or something," Kuai said to himself.

Makani pulled out a small black wallet and took out two twenty dollar bills that he had saved up from several weeks worth of allowance, finding the same salesperson he had talked to earlier, who pulled out a small iPod-like device and began to ring him up. Once he had his change and receipt, and his purchase sat safely inside a small, shiny bag with a silver Apple logo, the Hawaiian boy made his way back over to Kuai, the people in front of him quickly getting out of his way as he forged the crowded store. "Ya gonna get one of those?" he asked once he got close to Kuai, pointing at the phone in the teacher's hand.

"What?" Kuai took a second to remember what he had been looking at. "Oh, no. I'm still on contract for a few more months. Besides, you know Apple; there'll be a new one coming out next month for sure." He grinned and sat the phone back on its dock, and the two headed out of the store, waving goodbye to the friendly employee at the front as they left.

"Okay, now what?" Makani said. He seemed to have gotten even more energized than before, probably pumped from having so many people gawk at him admiringly.

"Well," Kuai turned his head to the long end of the mall's hallway, "didn't we come here to buy you some clothes?" A wry smile formed on his lips. "Maybe THAT'S what we should do next."

"Yeah! Look, there's an American Eagle store upstairs!" Makani pointed. "They always have some pretty awesome shirts."

"All right," Kuai nodded, "Let's head there next then." In the back of his mind he doubted that the smaller stores like that would have anything to properly fit a 6' 9" muscular boy, but he'd let Makani discover that on his own.

As the two entered the store, Makani headed straight to the fitted polos off at the righthand side. He stood back for a moment, looking over the dozen or so styles of shirts: orange ones, blue ones, red ones and black ones. Stepping closer, he began running his hands through all of the shirts, examining their tags. It took him a few minutes to finally pull out one with wide black and blue stripes and a small embroidered eagle on the chest. Makani held up the shirt to his torso, comparing it to see if it was anywhere close to big eough.

Unfortunately, it came up substantially short, looking like it wouldn't even cover his stomach if he tried it on. "I don't think that'll fit you, Makani," he said, rubbing his chin with his right hand. "What size is it?"

"Double X," Makani's head dropped, his dark hair falling into his eyes. "I can't find one that is any bigger."

Nodding in understanding, Kuai recalled his own troubles finding stylish clothes that fit him. "Excuse me," he said, waving down the only employee that seemed to be on the floor.

She came over, stopping for a moment when she finally got a good look at the 6' 9" boy, her eyes bulging slightly. "C-can I help you?"

"Yes, we're looking for some clothes," Kuai said. "What's the biggest size you carry?"

"XXL in the store, XXXL on the website." She eyed the boy from head to toe. "I'm afraid we don't make anything that'll fit either of you. I'm sorry."

Kuai shrugged, sighing. "Thank you anyway," he said. He saw the disappointment in Makani's eyes as the boy put the shirt back on the rack. "It's okay, we won't leave until we find something that'll work for you, even if we have to stay at the mall all night!" He patted Makani on the back, and the boy brushed the hair out of his eyes, the spark in them beginning to return.

They headed out of the store and towards the center of the mall, where Kuai saw an information desk. "They might know where we should look," he said softly. Walking up, he leaned against the counter and nodded at the smartly-dressed, almost prissy middle-aged man with greying hair who stood on the other side.

"Welcome to South Shore Plaza. How can I help you, sir?" The man spoke with a noticeable lisp and had a slight conceited attitude, repelling Kuai almost instantly.

"Yes, I was wondering if there are any Big and Tall stores in the mall. We're trying to find something that would fit Makani here." He motioned behind him, noticing that the boy was now posing for a picture along with a polite young Japanese couple that only came up to the bottom of his chest.

Kuai chuckled and faced forward again. He could feel the man judging both of them as his eyes examined Kuai, then as he turned to look at Makani from head to toe. Kuai had known a few guys like this who were friends of a friend or something like that. Arrogant old queens, he thought to himself. Finally, the man answered, "Unfortunately for you, sir, we don't have any specific Big and Tall stores inside South Shore Plaza. However, you might be able to find something serviceable at Macy's."

"Thank you," Kuai said, trying to hide his disgust and glad to be finished with that conversation. He stood back up to his full height and walked back over to Makani, who waved goodbye as the smiling couple bowed slightly and left. "C'mon, buddy, Macy's might have something that'll work for ya."

"Really? Awesome! Let's go!" The two turned around and headed to the large anchor store, which happened to be near where they had entered the mall at. As they walked, Makani seemed to become more and more excited with each person who turned to look at him, giving him a bit of an extra spring to his step. He seemed to have forgotten the letdown in the American Eagle store just a few minutes earlier. His glowing demeanor seemed almost contagious, and Kuai couldn't help but smile as well.
151111111112211111221.title: Not Easy to Fit

choices: Kuai demonstrates the pendant by making Makani grow right in the bedroom
Kuai asks Makani to follow him outside and grows him a foot taller
1511111111122111112212.content:
When Kuai and Makani walked through the doors of the large Macy’s department store, there were greeted by a large red-and blue sign which caught their attention almost immediately: “70% OFF ALL ITEMS in the MEN’S DEPARTMENT – TODAY ONLY”.

“Whoa! Did you see that?” Kuai cheered, as he pointed at the sign.

“Yeah! Let’s go!” the big Hawaiian boy shouted. “Not one minute to lose!”

The two large figures marched around the perimeter of the store, until they spotted the sign indicating that they had arrived at the Men’s Department. From there, they started browsing the many colorful racks, shelves, and stands for all the various types and name brands of shirts, t-shirts, slacks, coats, jackets, shoes, socks, underwear, undershirts, and any other article of clothing which they could find in Makani’s incredible size. Amazingly enough, the store was very well stocked, and they had everything from Adult Small to XXXL along with 'Tall' variations for each size. Makani made numerous trips to the dressing room, where he tried on different dress shoes in brown and black, undershirts, button shirts, polo shirts, t-shirts, and various types of slacks and jeans which he liked.

“Oh! Makani! You need one of these!” Kuai noted, as he had found a beautiful, black pinstriped suit consisting of a coat and matching slacks. “You’ll look so sharp in this along with your matching black dress shoes and a nice black leather belt!”

Makani dashed to the dressing room and immediately tried on the coat and the slacks. When he came out, he looked smashingly handsome!

“All you need now is a nice button shirt and a red tie, and you’ll be looking like a prince!

One of the sales associates came walking by, and she couldn’t help but stop and stare at the large Hawaiian boy who was now all dressed up in the black pinstriped suit.

“Wow! Look at the big hunk in the suit!” she giggled. This immediately made Makani blush, of course.

Kuai ended up buying Makani three or four ties and belts as well, to go with the slacks and the shoes, so he had a few matching sets of everything.

After having tried on the dressy clothes, Makani wanted to test out something more casual. He found some Bermuda shorts with a tank top and some sandals. He put them on, and they fit so well that he decided to keep them on for the rest of the evening. Kuai paid for the other clothes and Makani ended up carrying two large bags filled with clothing items as the two big guys left the store.

As they left the store, they strolled right past an ice cream parlor. Makani asked Kuai if he could have a cup of ice cream, so Kuai gave him some money. While Makani stood in line, another boy came up right behind him. As Makani ordered and paid for his ice cream, the boy standing next to him realized that Makani was a kid just by the way he talked and by the hi-pitched tone in his voice.

“Whoa! How old are you?” the boy asked him.

“Me? I’m twelve!” Makani replied. “What about you?”

“I’m thirteen! But-- you’re so big! You’re a giant!” the boy remarked, making Makani feel proud. Obviously, the boy was much shorter than him, and Makani thought that was way cool.

Makani walked back to the table where Kuai had sat down at, a huge grin on the boy's face.

“What are you smiling about, big guy?” Kuai asked him.

“This kid at the ice cream shop… He said I was a giant! He was a year older than me, but I’m still a lot bigger than him… Isn’t that weird?” Makani wondered out loud. “Everybody thinks I’m big!”

That last remark got Kuai thinking that perhaps it was time to tell Makani about the pendant. The more he thought about it, the more Kuai realized that it was a good idea to inform the boy that he had been responsible for the growth, and that he had the pendant which allowed him to grow Makani even bigger as well. Even while just looking at the muscular Pacific Islander, Kuai had the faint urge to make the boy grow a little bigger.

But he fought the urge and decided to wait until they arrived home, so that he could tell his student about the pendant and perhaps use the growth spurt in a demonstration without all the crowds around. Kuai pondered even changing some of the settings on the pendant, so that Makani could actually “feel” his body growing and notice when the growth spurt would start and end. If the boy was going to be able to see the pendant, Kuai realized he would have to turn the invisibility switch off as well. And, of course, Kuai didn’t want to make the boy outgrow his brand new clothes just yet, so he made sure that the setting which caused the boy's clothes to grow along with the rest of his big body was turned on. That would prevent Makani from bursting out of the clothes they had just bought.

Kuai stared at the pendant and formulated the best way he could bring it up to Makani. He supposed that if Makani didn’t believe him, he could make him grow a bit, just to erase any doubts.

Makani and Kuai finally left the mall and headed to the train station, returning home. As the boy started to put away all of his new clothes, Kuai stood outside the bedroom door, checking the pendant one last time, making sure the switches were set just like he wanted them to be. Taking a deep breath, he entered the boy's room and sat on the edge of the bed.

“Makani…. I've got something to tell you…” he said to the boy, who was standing in the center of the room.

“Sure? Whatya got?”

“I need to tell you something. You see, there's this pendant…”
1511111111122111112212.title: Sharply Dressed

choices: Makani wants to go to the park tomorrow (Saturday) and grow even more.
Makani wants to wait until school on Monday and see how big he can get in class
15111111111221111122121.content:
"Pendant?" Makani's eyes lit up as Kuai pulled out the pendant from around his neck. "Wow! That's pretty fancy! Kinda high-tech-looking."

Kuai chuckled. "You have no idea, really. And believe me, it's not just for show."

Makani sat down on the bed next to Kuai to take a closer look. "Wow, it's got a screen on it? What do all those switches do?"

"Well," Kuai started, "they're kind of like preference settings on a computer, I guess, just helping refine the main purpose of the pendant."

"Which is?" The Hawaiian boy's fiery eyes looked straight at Kuai's, full of curiosity.

Kuai could feel his heart start to beat faster. Why did this have to be so difficult? Oh yeah, he thought, because it sounds so crazy.

He swallowed hard, finally saying, "The pendant allows me to change things, like with my mind. Specifically, I've been using it to transform some of the boys at school."

Makani stared at Kuai in amazed silence for a few moments, then broke out in a laughing fit. "WHA--? BWAHAHA-- Mr. Ta-- HEEHEE--" He couldn't get out a word without cracking up for nearly thirty seconds, his eyes starting to water. Finally, he took a deep breath, wiped his eyes, and shook his head. "That's a good one, Mr. Ta-- I mean, Kuai. So what's it do, really?"

"I didn't think you'd believe me," Kuai said, a serious expression still on his face. "That's why I want to do this. Stand up for a minute."

Makani rolled his eyes slightly, rising to his full 6' 9" height. "Fine, I'll humor you, but only--"

The boy's words were cut off as he was overcome with a weird tingling sensation. As soon as he began to stand, Kuai started focused on him growing to the ceiling, which was almost eight feet from the floor. Nearly instantly, the muscles in Makani's body started to tingle and flex, his bones stretching outward as his head inched towards the ceiling.

This was the first time Kuai had allowed the target of growth to be aware of what was happening, and the sense of wonder and incredulity in the boy's eyes was truly something special. As he passed seven feet tall, Makani began running his hands down his shirt, which had grown along with him, amazed by how long his torso was getting and how far away the ground was starting to look. "Wha- what's happening to me?!" he asked, a little scared, Kuai thought, but also with a sense of excitement beginning to set in.

The rest of his frame was expanding as well. His shoulders widened, and his strong, muscled back now looked truly enormous. His feet, barefoot from having kicked off his shoes when he came in the house, now were nearly the size of two rowing oars, and Kuai chuckled when Makani started to wiggle his toes, guessing the boy didn't believe they were still his.

Kuai hadn't decided to change Makani's muscles at all for now, but the height increase made them grow in proportion to the rest of his body, and just the sheer sight of the giant beefy boy was enough to cause Kuai to marvel at his own work. Makani now looked like he could rip a phone book in half, or pull a small tree up from its roots.

Finally, the top of Makani's head brushed against the ceiling, and his growing stopped. He had gone from being very large and impressive, to nearly being like a Greek god, the perception of power emanating from his body to all those around (which, unfortunately, was just Kuai for the moment).

"Holy crap!" Makani exclaimed. "I'm a giant!"

Kuai laughed. "You were already pretty much a giant before. Now you're just more of one."

"This is amazing!" Makani twisted his hips back and forth, taking a look at his front and backside. He tilted his head up to the ceiling, ducking down instinctively when he realized how close he was to it. "So how exactly does the pendant make the changes? Is it magic?"

"Nah, it's powered by nanites or something," Kuai shrugged, "I'm not really sure. I just know that it works."

"Wow," Makani shook his head in wonder as he sat down on the bed, which sagged a little under his new bulk. Kuai couldn't help but be amazed to be looking up at a twelve-year-old boy who was over a foot taller than him. Makani stretched out his long, bronze legs, his feet nearly reaching the opposite wall. "Ya know, for the past year, I kinda thought I wouldn't get any taller than I was. I mean, I'd been 6'9" for so long, I thought I just had my growth spurt really early and I was finished. But now--"

"Actually," Kuai interrupted, "I have something to tell you about that as well." Makani tilted his head, looking at him questioningly. Sighing slightly, Kuai started his confession. "So, I got the pendant in the mail at the beginning of the school year. A friend from California sent it to me the day before classes started, and I brought it with me. I changed several boys that day, making them bigger or taller or whatever..." Kuai paused, bracing himself for what Makani's reaction would be to his next words. "...and you were one of them."

The Hawaiian boy's eyes bulged, and his mouth fell open in shock. "What? But I don't remember any changes!"

"That's because of the settings on the pendant," Kuai explained. "The only person who is aware of the changes is whoever wears the pendant, unless he allows either the one who is changed or everyone else to realize it. That's what those switches were for. In fact, even now the only people who should be completely aware of your change in height should be you or me, unless I change the settings again"

Makani seemed to still be in shock, and Kuai was dying to be inside the boy's head and know what he was thinking. He also felt a new sense coming over him: remorse for keeping his actions hidden for so long.

Finally, the boys tilted his head towards Kuai slightly and spoke. "So... so I haven't always been tall and strong?"

Kuai shook his head. "Not by a long shot. On that first day, you were skinny and a bit on the short side. I changed you while you introduced yourself to the class because... Well, because I liked you. I liked the mixture of your shy nature with your pride, both for your heritage and your family. You're an interesting kid, Makanki; you have a fire in your eyes that just... drew me in, I guess."

Makani appeared to be lost in thought. "I remember coming to after a small seizure at the end of your class that first day, and I remember you being so supportive and fair about it. I don't remember growing or anything like that."

"Then the pendant did it's job," Kuai nodded. "I probably should've told you sometime sooner, but we've become such good friends partially because of that, and I enjoyed making you grow too much. I'm sorry."

Feeling a little embarrassed, Kuai hung his head low. But out of the corner of his eye, he saw Makani's face light up. "Sorry?! What are you sorry for?" the giant boy enthused. "This is the best thing that could ever have happened to me! I love being the biggest guy I know, and having everyone look at me in awe wherever I go. I can't believe you think I could be anything but ecstatic with this."

Kuai suddenly felt the large, muscled arms of the Hawaiian boy wrap around him in a powerful hug. He gently squeezed back, unsure if Makani even realized that Kuai was doing so. "Well, Makani," Kuai said, "I'm certainly glad you like being so tall. It certainly takes a load off of my back."

Makani jumped up to his feet, nearly hitting his head on the ceiling, as he turned to face Kuai, an excited, hopeful look on his face. He looked like he was about to ask something.
15111111111221111122121.title: Confessions and a Demonstration

choices: The giant boy in the pool.
Kuai decides to grow another kid at the pool.
151111111112211111221211.content:
“Hey, ummm… Kuai?” the big Hawaiian boy asked his teacher with a huge smile on his face. “Can we go to the park tomorrow?”

“Sure, Makani! We can do that. We can go for a walk, we can watch the other kids play baseball, and we can even go to the public pool which is right next door!”

“Well… I wanted to go to the park just so that we can be outside. That way, you can try out the pendant some more!” Makani grinned.

Kuai thought about the boy's words when it dawned on him: the giant wanted him to make him grow even bigger than he was now!

“Ohhh…. I see where this is going! You want me to make you even bigger, huh?”

“Please?” Makani asked again. This time, he was almost begging Kuai to make him bigger.

“You know that if I make you an inch taller than you are now, I’ll have to shrink you back later on, or else you won’t fit through the door?” Kuai noted. “You will have outgrown the house then!”

“I know! I just wanted to see what it’s like to be really big… Like… Over ten feet tall!” the boy said cheerfully.

“Alright, big guy!” Kuai chuckled, as he stood and walked up to the giant boy, having to crane his neck in order to look up to the big kid, who was standing almost two feet taller than him now. “Let’s have dinner and get some sleep, okay?”

“Yes, sir!” Makani beamed, as he turned around and set the table while Kuai ordered a pizza for him, Makani and Sean.

Of course, Sean was totally astonished when he saw how big the Hawaiian boy had become! He barely made it up to the boy’s abdominals, and it seemed weird looking up to a twelve-year-old kid who was so big and so muscular while standing almost three feet taller than him!

“Okay, dude! You’re scaring me!” Sean gasped, when he walked through the door. “You’re gonna outgrow the house!”

“Yeah!” Makani cheered. “I plan on doing that!”

Kuai ordered several pizzas, since one wasn’t enough to feed two big adult men and one giant boy. He ordered three pizzas, and he decided to save whatever was left in the fridge for the next day. That evening, the three of them just watched a movie on the big flat screen TV, before Makani crawled in bed and dozed off into a deep sleep.

Makani was the first one awake that Saturday morning, which was typical for a twelve year-old boy. Kuai found him on the living room floor, watching cartoons, which was to be expected for a kid of his age. Makani was already dressed up in a tank top and shorts with tennis shoes, and he was ready to go out and have some fun in the park. Kuai took the boy to a bagel place down the street, where the two of them had a bagel for breakfast before they headed to the large public park. There, the two wandered around and observed a group of kids playing soccer at the soccer field, when they came by a concrete basketball court which was unused.

“I got an idea!” Makani cheered, as he ran towards the court and got all the way up to the hoop. He stood right next to the post, which supported the rim and the backboard, and patiently waited for Kuai to arrive.

“Ahhh… Yes… The rim should be exactly ten feet from the ground!” Kuai noted, as he compared the height of the rim to the top of Makani’s head. He guessed that the difference was indeed about two feet.

“Yeah! So, if you make me reach the hoop, then I’ll be ten feet tall!” Makani grinned.

“Okay, big guy! Just stand straight and don’t move!” Kuai instructed, as he focused on the Hawaiian boy. Using the basketball hoop as a measuring tool, he focused on Makani and imagined the boy becoming even bigger and taller, until the top of his head reached the edge of the red metal hoop.

Makani felt his arms, his torso, and his legs tingle all over the place, as bones cracked while limbs began to elongate and grow all at once, thanks to the magic of the pendant. Due to the way Kuai had the switches set, Makani’s clothes would also grow along with his body, preventing him from bursting out of his clothes. The boy’s shoes grew even bigger than they already were as his enormous feet continued to expand to gigantic proportions. His phenomenal legs stretched out as his muscles grew bigger at the same time. His calves truly became rock-hard and huge, transforming into the biggest calves on earth. The same counted for his thighs and his biceps, which were gigantic by now! The kid had become a true titan!

Makani’s abs continued to grow even bigger while his torso grew taller and wider. His shoulders became broader than they were already and his arms were just colossal by now! For Kuai, it was almost a pity to stop the growth at ten feet. He knew that he would make the boy even bigger real soon! The bigger he made Makani, the cooler the boy looked to him!

“This is so awesome!” Makani cheered, as he looked over and realized that he was the same height as the basketball hoop. “I can dunk without jumping!”

“Uhh… Most guys will be too afraid to play basketball with you, Makani! They wouldn’t want to defend you, trust me!” Kuai pointed out.

Makani walked over to Kuai and the two of them headed over to the large pond, where people were feeding the ducks. Right away, several kids walked over to the giant ten-foot-tall boy. Kuai couldn’t help but chuckle when he saw that Makani had become a big attraction for kids of all ages.

“Whoa! How big are you?”

“How old are you?”

“How tall are you?”

Makani kept on getting these questions from several kids, who came up to him. They all stared with wonder and awe at the giant boy, who was as big and as tall as a giant, but who still looked like a kid and who walked and talked like a young boy. At least, Makani had the face and the voice of a kid.

“Hey, Makani! Let’s go for a swim in the pool! I brought some towels and I got you your swimming trunks!” Kuai said.

“Oh boy!” Makani smiled. “I can’t wait to go swimming, especially now that I’m big!”

As Kuai and Makani looked over, they saw the large public pool straight ahead of them, surrounded by lounge chairs, a snack bar, a building containing the showers, and two high chairs were the lifeguards were seated. Obviously, there were numerous gasps from the parents, the kids, and the life guards at the pool when Kuai and Makani walked up, looking for a chair where they could set down their towels and their bags. This was going to be a fun afternoon for Kuai and his ten-foot giant!
151111111112211111221211.title: Double Digits

choices: Makani grows even more in the park
They go somewhere else, and Kuai turns a giant into a titan
1511111111122111112212111.content:
Kuai already noticed one problem with having Makani as a giant: the oversized kid had a hard time fitting through doors and squeezing into buildings that were built for “average” people. Using his pendant, Kuai decided to quietly shrink Makani back to eight feet tall, so that the boy could at least get into the locker room and change into his swimming trunks. Once the tall Hawaiian came out, he made him grow back to ten feet tall, and the big boy was happy as a clam!

Makani wandered around the perimeter of the pool, until he reached the deepest end. A sign painted on the edge of the pool indicated that the pool was nine feet deep at that point.

“Don’t dive in, Makani!” Kuai warned the big boy. “It’s still too shallow for you!”

Kuai realized that Makani had already reached the point now where he had become too big to do certain things, and diving into a pool that was nine feet deep when he was ten feet tall wasn’t a good idea.

“No problem, Kuai! I’ll jump in right here!” Makani replied.

The big boy just leaped into the air and landed in the water with a huge splash, grabbing his ankles in mid-air. The boy hit the water like a huge bomb, setting off several huge waves, much to the delight of all the other kids who were swimming in the other area of the pool. 

Kuai got on a lounge chair next to another chair where a nice gentleman was just watching the kids in the pool. 

“Wow, lots of kids in the pool today, huh?” the man said to Kuai.

“Oh, absolutely!” Kuai responded.

“See the boy with the red trunks? That’s my boy, Jason!” the man said proudly.

Kuai then pointed to Makani, who clearly stuck out above all the other kids who were swimming in the pool.

“See that kid with the blue trunks? That’s my boy. His name is Makani!”

The man looked up in complete amazement when he realized that Kuai was pointing at the giant Hawaiian boy.

“You mean… That really big kid who’s swimming in the pool? The one who just jumped in right now?”

Kuai just nodded in reply.

“Wow! That is one HUGE kid! Oh, my name is Jonathan, by the way. And, like I said, my son’s name is Jason! He’s thirteen years old!” Jonathan said, as he reached out to shake Kuai’s hand.

“Nice to meet you! I’m Kuai!”

Just then Kuai got a text message from Nick from California, asking about the pendant. An idea just came to him. 

“Jonathan, do you mind taking a picture of us?” Kuai asked him.

“Sure! Maybe Jason would like to be in a picture with your giant kid!”

Both Kuai and Jonathan called out to their boys, and they climbed out of the pool. Jonathan took Kuai’s cell phone as Kuai, Makani and Jason huddled together with Makani standing in the background, since he was the tallest, by far. Kuai and Jason stood right in front of him, with the giant ten-foot-tall boy looming over them in the background. Jonathan had to take several steps back in order to get all of Makani to fit in the frame, before taking two pictures of the three of them. Then, he handed the cell phone back to Kuai.

Both Jason and Makani jumped back in the pool, and Makani just stood on his feet, with his head sticking out a foot above the water since he was a foot taller than the water line of the pool anyway. Several kids swam over to the giant boy, and started climbing on his shoulders and used his big, broad shoulders as a diving board. 

Kuai couldn’t help but grin when he saw that Makani had once again become a big kid-magnet, even in the pool. All the kids were immediately attracted to the giant boy, and they were all swimming around him like bees buzzing around honey. They each took turns climbing his broad shoulders so they could jump from them into the pool, which didn’t have a diving board. That way, they could pick which side of the water they could jump into, since they were using Makani as a diving platform.

Then Kuai heard one of the boys make an interesting remark.

“Man… I wish you were a little bit taller so we could dive even higher into the pool!” 

Kuai quietly took hold of the pendant and imagined Makani growing once again. This time, he made the giant boy grow another two feet taller, until he was twelve feet tall! Makani’s chest was now sticking out above the water line, and he was truly a sight to behold! Standing twice as tall as an average adult, the big Hawaiian boy had to lift the kids on to his broad shoulders so that they could jump into the water.

“Wow! How did your boy get to be so big?” Jonathan asked Kuai.

“Oh… He’s from a big family… He’s got good genetics, I guess…” Kuai responded with a smile.

Just then Nick called him on his cell phone.

“Kuai! Who’s the big kid in the picture? Holy smoke!” Nick gasped.

“That’s Makani Akamu-Oke. He is one of my students. His fathers had to leave for a few months and I decided to take him in. The boy is from Hawaii and let me tell you, he just loves to grow!” 

“How big is he now?”

“I just increased his height to twelve feet! The kids adore him and the boy just loves being a giant! This kid is built to grow! He is the main attraction everywhere he goes!”

“You’re not kidding!” Nick gasped. “Have you given him a big growth spurt yet? Like made him twenty feet tall? Or even bigger?”

“No, not yet. I decided to grow him just a few feet at a time. So far, he’s loved every minute of it!”

“Well, when you take him outside to the park or something, give him a big growth spurt and see how he likes it. Then send me a picture of our giant boy. I’m dying to see how he turns out!”

“Ooh, we’re at a public pool by a park right now! So, I might try that after he’s done swimming!” Kuai said with a smile on his face. “Trust me, this kid loves being big!”

Kuai just couldn’t wait to give Makani his next growth spurt. The hardest part was deciding how big he was going to grow the giant Hawaiian boy…
1511111111122111112212111.title: Making Waves

choices: The giant at the fair
Makani goes to school the next day
15111111111221111122121111.content:
Kuai began to wonder how much fun a giant twelve-foot-tall muscle boy could have in a pool while he was surrounded by half a dozen kids who were all taking turns climbing on his shoulders so they could dive in the water. Then, once Makani started floating around on his back, the kids wanted to use the giant teen as a living raft. They took turns climbing on his torso and they would sit on his huge chest before sliding back into the water. For these kids, having Makani in the pool was nothing more than a huge treat, and Kuai noted that this was only the beginning of the giant boy’s celebrity status.

When Makani finally climbed out of the pool and dried off, Kuai suggested that the two of them would go walk around the park a bit before heading home for dinner. As they wandered past the trees and bushes in the large recreational park, Makani suddenly stopped and looked up, scanning one of the trees for something.

“Did you hear that? Look! Over there!” the huge boy noted, as he pointed to an animal that was standing on one of the branches of a large oak tree.
